pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:0.5.eng: The training rule on exchanging what belongs to a group

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa pūgassa pariveṇavāsikā bhikkhuniyo yāguyā kilamanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.2.eng: At that time the nuns staying in the yard belonging to a certain association were weak because of a lack of congee.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.2.comm: “Yard” renders pariveṇa. For a discussion of this word, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.3.pli: Atha kho so pūgo bhikkhunīnaṃ yāguatthāya chandakaṃ saṅgharitvā aññatarassa āpaṇikassa ghare parikkhāraṃ nikkhipitvā bhikkhuniyo upasaṅkamitvā etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.3.eng: Then, after collecting voluntary contributions to supply the nuns with congee, that association stored the ingredients in a shop. They then went to the nuns and said,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.3.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “ingredients” for parikkhāra, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.4.pli: “amukassa, ayye, āpaṇikassa ghare yāguatthāya parikkhāro nikkhitto, tato taṇḍulaṃ āharāpetvā yāguṃ pacāpetvā paribhuñjathā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.4.eng: “Venerables, congee ingredients are stored in such-and-such a shop. Please have someone get rice from there, have congee cooked, and then eat it.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.5.pli: Bhikkhuniyo tena parikkhārena bhesajjaṃ cetāpetvā paribhuñjiṃsu.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.5.eng: But the nuns exchanged those ingredients for tonics, which they then used.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.6.pli: So pūgo jānitvā ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.6.eng: When that association found out about this, they complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena mahājanikena aññaṃ cetāpessantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.7.eng: “When collective ingredients are designated for a specific purpose, how could the nuns exchange them for something else?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena mahājanikena aññaṃ cetāpentī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nuns did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena mahājanikena aññaṃ cetāpessanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.11.eng: “When collective ingredients are designated for a specific purpose, how could the nuns exchange them for something else?

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.14.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena mahājanikena aññaṃ cetāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:1.14.1.eng: ‘When a collective requisite is designated for a specific purpose, if a nun exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.5.eng: A requisite is designated for a specific purpose:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.6.eng: it was given for a specific purpose.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.8.eng: belonging to a group, not to the Sangha, not to an individual nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.10.pli: yaṃatthāya dinnaṃ taṃ ṭhapetvā aññaṃ cetāpeti, payoge dukkaṭaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.10.eng: if, apart from the purpose for which it was given, she exchanges it for something else, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.11.eng: When she gets it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.12.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā ekabhikkhuniyā vā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.12.eng: It should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.13.eng: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.14.eng: (To be expanded as in Bi Np 1:2.1.21–Bi Np 1:2.1.43, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.15.pli: “idaṃ me, ayye, aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena mahājanikena aññaṃ cetāpitaṃ nissaggiyaṃ imāhaṃ saṅghassa nissajjāmī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.15.eng: ‘Venerables, this thing, which I got in exchange for a collective requisite that was designated for a specific purpose, is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.19.1.pli: Aññadatthike aññadatthikasaññā aññaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.19.1.eng: If it is for a specific purpose and she perceives that it is, and she exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.20.pli: Aññadatthike vematikā aññaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.20.eng: If it is for a specific purpose, but she is unsure of it, and she exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.21.pli: Aññadatthike anaññadatthikasaññā aññaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.21.eng: If it is for a specific purpose, but she does not perceive that it is, and she exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.22.eng: When she receives in return what had been relinquished, it is to be used in accordance with the intention of the donors.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.22.comm: Vmv 2.740: nissaṭṭhaṁ paṭilabhitvāpi yaṁ uddissa dāyakehi dinnaṁ, tattheva dātabbaṁ. Tenāha “yathādāneyeva upanetabba”nti, “Having obtained what was relinquished, it is to be given in accordance with the designation of the donors. Yathādāneyeva upanetabbaṁ is said in regard to this.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.23.eng: If it is not for a specific purpose, but she perceives that it is, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.24.eng: If it is not for a specific purpose, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.25.eng: If it is not for a specific purpose, and she does not perceive that it is, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.27.comm: This seems to mean that if there is a remainder after the requisites have been used as intended, then this may be exchanged for something other than what was specified. Sp 2.762: Sesakaṁ upanetīti yadatthāya dinno, taṁ cetāpetvā avasesaṁ aññassatthāya upaneti, “She uses the remainder means: after exchanging it for the purpose for which it was given, she uses the remainder for another purpose.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.28.eng: if she uses it after getting permission from the owners;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.28.comm: That is, if she makes use of it in another way than what was intended by the owners. Sp 2.762: Sāmike apaloketvāti “tumhehi cīvaratthāya dinno, amhākañca cīvaraṁ atthi, telādīhi pana attho”ti evaṁ āpucchitvā upaneti, “After getting permission from the owners means: she makes use of it after asking, ‘It was given by you for the purpose of robes, but we have robes and we need oil, etc.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.31.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np8:2.32.eng: The eighth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np9:0.5.eng: The second training rule on exchanging what belongs to a group

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:0.6.pli: Ime kho panāyyāyo chasaṭṭhisatā pācittiyā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:0.6.eng: Venerables, these one hundred and sixty-six rules on offenses entailing confession come up for recitation.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarena upāsakena bhikkhunisaṅgho lasuṇena pavārito hoti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.2.eng: At that time a lay follower had invited the Sangha of nuns to ask for garlic:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.3.eng: “If any of the nuns need garlic, I’ll supply it.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.4.eng: And he had told his field-keeper,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.5.pli: “sace bhikkhuniyo āgacchanti, ekamekāya bhikkhuniyā dvetayo bhaṇḍike dehī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.5.eng: “If the nuns come, give two or three bulbs to each nun.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.5.comm: “Bulb” renders bhaṇḍika. Normally I render this word as “bundle”, but here the intended meaning seems to be a “bundle” of cloves, that is, a single bulb of garlic. Sp 2.793: Dve tayo bhaṇḍiketi dve vā tayo vā poṭṭalike; sampuṇṇamiñjānametaṁ adhivacanaṁ, “Two or three bhaṇḍika: two or three bundles; this is an expression for being complete in cloves.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.6.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāvatthiyaṃ ussavo hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.6.eng: On that occasion they were holding a celebration in Sāvatthī,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.7.eng: and the garlic was used up as soon as it arrived there.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.8.eng: Just then the nuns went to that lay follower and said,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.11.eng: As soon as the garlic arrives, it’s used up.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.13.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī khettaṃ gantvā na mattaṃ jānitvā bahuṃ lasuṇaṃ harāpesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.13.eng: The nun Thullanandā went to the field, and not having any sense of moderation she took a large amount of garlic.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.14.eng: The field-keeper complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.15.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo na mattaṃ jānitvā bahuṃ lasuṇaṃ harāpessantī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.15.eng: “How can the nuns not have any sense of moderation and take a large amount of garlic?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.16.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tassa khettapālassa ujjhāyantassa khiyyantassa vipācentassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.16.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of that field-keeper,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.17.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.17.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.18.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā na mattaṃ jānitvā bahuṃ lasuṇaṃ harāpessatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.18.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā not have any sense of moderation and take a large amount of garlic?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.19.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī na mattaṃ jānitvā bahuṃ lasuṇaṃ harāpetī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.19.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.22.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī na mattaṃ jānitvā bahuṃ lasuṇaṃ harāpessati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.22.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā not have any sense of moderation and take a large amount of garlic?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.24.eng: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.25.1.pli: “Bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī aññatarassa brāhmaṇassa pajāpati ahosi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.25.1.eng: “Once upon a time, monks, Thullanandā was the wife of a brahmin.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.28.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, so brāhmaṇo kālaṃ katvā aññataraṃ haṃsayoniṃ upapajji.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.28.eng: When that brahmin eventually died, he was reborn as a goose,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.29.eng: whose feathers were all made of gold.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.30.eng: And he gave his former family members one feather at the time.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.31.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī ‘ayaṃ haṃso amhākaṃ ekekaṃ pattaṃ detī’ti taṃ haṃsarājaṃ gahetvā nippattaṃ akāsi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.31.eng: Thullanandā considered this. She then grabbed hold of that king of geese and plucked him.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.32.pli: Tassa puna jāyamānā pattā setā sampajjiṃsu.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.32.eng: But when his feathers regrew they were white.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.33.pli: Tadāpi, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī atilobhena suvaṇṇā parihīnā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.33.eng: At that time too, monks, Thullanandā lost her gold because she was too greedy.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.34.eng: Now she will lose her garlic.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.35.eng: “One should be content with what one gets,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.37.eng: After grabbing hold of the king of geese,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.38.eng: The gold came to an end.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.39.pli: Atha kho bhagavā thullanandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā dubbharatāya …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.39.eng: Then, after rebuking the nun Thullanandā in many ways, the Buddha spoke in dispraise of being difficult to support …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.40.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.40.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.41.1.eng: ‘If a nun eats garlic, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.1.6.eng: from Magadha is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.1.7.eng: If she receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.1.7.comm: The punctuation of the Pali should presumably be amended to ‘Khādissāmī”ti paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.1.8.eng: For every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.2.1.eng: If it is garlic and she perceives it as such, and she eats it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.2.2.eng: If it is garlic, but she is unsure of it, and she eats it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.2.3.eng: If it is garlic, but she does not perceive it as such, and she eats it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.2.4.eng: If it is not garlic, but she perceives it as such, and she eats it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.2.5.eng: If it is not garlic, but she is unsure of it, and she eats it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.2.6.eng: If it is not garlic and she does not perceive it as such, and she eats it, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.3.3.comm: DOP says of the bhañjanaka that it is “a kind of onion or similar vegetable”. The commentarial description, however, is an almost perfect fit for a shallot. Sp 2.797: Bhañjanako lohitavaṇṇo. … Miñjāya pana … bhañjanakassa dve, “The bhañjanaka is red. … But in regard to cloves … the bhañjanaka has two.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.3.4.comm: The botanical name is Terminalia chebula, see SED and SAF, p. 57. It is also known as “black myrobalan”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.3.5.eng: if it is a spring onion;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.3.5.comm: DOP suggests “spring onion” for cāpalasuṇa with a question mark. Its identity therefore remains uncertain. Sp 2.797: Cāpalasuṇo amiñjako, aṅkuramattameva hi tassa hoti, “The cāpalasuṇa does not have cloves. It is just a sprout.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.3.6.eng: if it is cooked in a bean curry;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.3.7.eng: if it is cooked with meat;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.3.8.eng: if it is cooked with oil;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.3.9.comm: “Sweets” renders sāḷava. SED, sv. shāḍava, says: “confectionery, sweetmeats”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.3.10.eng: if it is a special curry;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.3.12.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.3.13.eng: The training rule on garlic, the first, is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:0.5.eng: The training rule on dancing and singing

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājagahe giraggasamajjo hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:1.2.eng: At that time in Rājagaha there was a hilltop fair,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:1.3.eng: and the nuns from the group of six went to see it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo naccampi gītampi vāditampi dassanāya gacchissanti, seyyathāpi gihiniyo kāmabhoginiyo”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:1.5.eng: “How can nuns go to see dancing, singing, and music? They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:1.6.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:1.6.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:1.7.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:1.7.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo naccampi gītampi vāditampi dassanāya gacchissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:1.8.eng: “How could the nuns from the group of six go to see dancing, singing, and music?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo naccampi gītampi vāditampi dassanāya gacchantī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:1.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns did that?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo naccampi gītampi vāditampi dassanāya gacchissanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:1.12.eng: “How could the nuns from the group of six do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:1.14.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:1.15.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī naccaṃ vā gītaṃ vā vāditaṃ vā dassanāya gaccheyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:1.15.1.eng: ‘If a nun goes to see dancing or singing or music, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.1.11.eng: If she is on her way to see it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.1.12.pli: Yattha ṭhitā passati vā suṇāti vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.1.12.eng: Wherever she stands to see it or hear it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.1.13.pli: Dassanūpacāraṃ vijahitvā punappunaṃ passati vā suṇāti vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.1.13.eng: Every time she goes beyond the range of sight and then sees it or hears it again, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.1.14.eng: If she is on her way to see any one of the three, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.1.15.pli: Yattha ṭhitā passati vā suṇāti vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.1.15.eng: Wherever she stands to see it or hear it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.1.16.pli: Dassanūpacāraṃ vijahitvā punappunaṃ passati vā suṇāti vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.1.16.eng: Every time she goes beyond the range of sight and then sees it or hears it again, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.2.2.pli: ārāme ṭhitā passati vā suṇāti vā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.2.2.eng: if she sees it or hears it while remaining in the monastery;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.2.3.pli: bhikkhuniyā ṭhitokāsaṃ vā nisinnokāsaṃ vā nipannokāsaṃ vā āgantvā naccanti vā gāyanti vā vādenti vā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.2.3.eng: if the dancing, singing, or music comes to the place where the nun is standing, sitting, or lying down;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.2.4.pli: paṭipathaṃ gacchantī passati vā suṇāti vā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.2.4.eng: if she sees it or hears it while walking in the opposite direction;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.2.5.pli: sati karaṇīye gantvā passati vā suṇāti vā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.2.5.eng: if she goes there because there is something to be done and she then sees it or hears it;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.2.8.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.2.9.eng: The tenth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc10:2.2.10.eng: The first subchapter on garlic is finished.
